node.title: More Queenstown Covid-19 locations of interest listed
node.description: The Ministry of Health has listed more Covid-19 locations of interest in Queenstown, including a gym, a supermarket and a bar.
node.content:
["The Ministry of Health has listed more Covid-19 locations of interest in Queenstown, including a gym, a supermarket and a bar.", "", "
\nPhoto: 123rf.com\n
", "Positive cases have now been found in Queenstown, Dunedin, Invercargill, Gore, Tekapo and W\u0101naka and the Southern District Health Board is urging anyone with cold or flu-like symptoms to get tested.", "People who visited the Queenstown Events Centre on Tuesday 8 February from 6.45pm-9pm and the Cowboy bar on Sunday 6 February from 7pm-10pm are asked to self isolate and get a test immediately and on day 5.", "Those who visited New World Remarkables Park in Frankton on Sunday 6 February from 7.30am-745am are asked to self monitor for symptoms.", "They join the list of 20-plus locations in the resort town, including nine hospitality venues.", "Anyone who was at the named locations is encouraged to check the ministry's website for advice.", "Meanwhile, a Lake Tekapo cafe and a W\u0101naka lavender farm have also been listed as locations of interest.", "Anyone who was at Mackenzies Cafe Bar & Grill in Tekapo between 5.00pm - 5.45pm on Sunday 6 February should self-isolate, get a test, and record their visit online.", "Anyone who visited the W\u0101naka Lavender Farm between 12.39pm and 1.30pm last Monday, should self-monitor for symptoms."]
